content: Investments Stocks Discussion Regular Shares Savings Plans (RSS) ETF Asked by AnonymousAsked on 23 Jul 2019Should I withdraw my funds from POSB RSP and put it into S&P ETFs?I've been investing under POSB's RSP for a while now. Am currently thinking if I should switch over to investing in S&P ETFs instead. Anyone in a similar position before? What would you advise?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 24 Jul 2019Historically, the S&P has done better than the STI ETF.
However, there is no regular investment plan for S&P ETF specifically. So if you are trying to manually do a dollar cost average into S&P, the broker fees might eat into your capitalThere are roboadvisors with a mix of ETFs though.0 comments0
